To bring or be brought to a further stage of development; improve.
To soothe, moderate, or relieve (grief, pain, etc).
To be present at (an event, meeting, etc).
To weaken or become weak; reduce in size, strength, density, or value.
Tolerant of opposing viewpoints; not prejudiced; liberal.
A small pointed lump that appears on a tree or plant and develops into a leaf or flower.
A layer of something that spreads out and covers an area.
Someone who is responsible for looking after another person.
A person or thing that causes a change.
To laugh in a way that shows you are very pleased.
To produce (something) at a rapid rate [informal].
Something that helps to solve a problem or unravel a mystery.
To work on or tend (something) carefully and patiently so as to make it function as one desires.
A group of people with a statistic in common, esp having been born in the same year.
To gather pieces of information together and examine them.
A substance that contains atoms of two or more chemical elements held together by chemical bonds.
Relating to marriage or a married couple's relationship.
To move or cause to move towards the same point.
Made in imitation of something genuine with the intent to deceive or defraud.
To produce at a steady and prolific rate [informal].
Growing in quantity, strength, or effect by successive additions or gradual steps.
Fragments or remnants of something destroyed or broken; rubble.
To describe the nature, properties, or essential qualities of.
To resist (a powerful person, authority, etc) openly and boldly.
A deviation or variation from previous custom; divergence.
Not directed towards one place or concentrated in one place but spread out over a large area.
To conceal (one's real motives, emotions, etc) by pretence.
To invest with a title, name, or nickname.
To make clear (something obscure or difficult); clarify.
The quality of being very well-known and highly respected.
An effort to do or attain something.
To give approval or sanction to.
To give information or understanding to; instruct; edify.
Irregular in performance, behaviour, or attitude; inconsistent and unpredictable.
To explain or set forth (an argument, theory, etc) in detail.
A piece of unreliable information believed to be true because of the way it is presented or repeated in print.
Designating or of a statement, theory, etc. that is so formulated as to permit empirical testing and, therefore, can be shown to be false.
A remarkable, skilful, or daring action; exploit; achievement.
The act or activity of betting money, for example in card games or on horse racing.
To gather (something) slowly and carefully in small pieces.
To visit (a person or place) in the form of a ghost.
As a result of; succeeding, following.
Not able to be escaped from.
A portion of something that is issued, broadcast, or published in parts, such as a serial in a magazine.
Occurring with almost no delay; happening or completed within a moment.
Without taking account of; regardless of.
To make (something) active, functional, or productive again.
To include a lot of words of a particular kind in one's speech or writing.
A sum of money that you have to pay, for example as a tax to the government.
A series of instructions in a program, performed repeatedly until some specified condition is satisfied.
A great work of art or literature, esp the greatest single work of an artist.
To serve as a medium for causing (a result) or transferring (objects, information, etc).
The act or art of copying or imitating closely.
To reflect, represent, or depict faithfully.
The state or quality of being outrageous or ugly.
Having a large number or great variety.
Starting to grow or develop; being born.
To make ineffective or void; nullify; invalidate.
Any of the taxonomic groups into which a class is divided and which contains one or more families.
To give the main features or general idea of.
Extremely careful, esp as to fine detail.
To happen at the same time or to be similar, and often to seem to be connected.
A combination of items made by reordering.
The state or fact of being an individual or having human characteristics and feelings.
Any communal combination of resources, funds, etc.
To assume or put forward as fact or the factual basis for an argument.
To poke or jab with or as if with a pointed object.
A substance added in small amounts to a catalyst to increase its activity.
To justify (one's actions, esp discreditable actions, or beliefs) with plausible reasons, esp after the event.
To direct (a patient) for treatment to another doctor, usually a specialist.
To think, meditate, or ponder [usually foll by on].
A systematic way of life or course of therapy, often including exercise and a recommended diet.
A person or thing that ensures protection against danger, damage, injury, etc.
To get (a specified grade) on a test.
A feeling, emotion, or awareness; a mental attitude modified or determined by feeling.
Anything that is not what it purports or appears to be.
Software that is of a poor quality due to hasty development and lack of rigorous testing [computing informal].
To show indifference or disregard for (someone).
A small thin piece or amount of something.
To absorb with one's mind or senses; take in.
To make a change or event happen faster or sooner.
A special jacket used to tie the arms of a violent person tightly around their body.
Very likely to be influenced by something or someone.
Involved in a complicated or unpleasant situation and not being able to get free of it.
A large container or reservoir for the storage of liquids or gases.
To strike (something) lightly and usually repeatedly.
A medicinal extract in a solution of alcohol.
To play, fiddle, or meddle (with machinery, etc), esp while undertaking repairs.
In a confused or disorganised state [informal].
To afflict with great pain, suffering, or anguish; torture.
To be the foundation, cause, or basis of.
A strong impulse, inner drive, or yearning.
To move, carry, etc, with a light or rapid sweeping motion.
Using sophisticated technology to produce vivid effects [informal].
Amusingly clever in perception and expression.
